title: Time
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the real-world **time**, **date** and **moon phase** all affect gameplay, and are determined by your system clock. While it is possible to change the system clock to get a desired moon phase or time, this is considered [cheating](/wiki/Cheating "Cheating").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Moon phase and date](#Moon_phase_and_date)
- [2 Time](#Time)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 References](#References)

## Moon phase and date

[![](/images/thumb/8/83/Moon_phase_6.gif/180px-Moon_phase_6.gif)](/wiki/File:Moon_phase_6.gif)



On 26 September 2024, the [moon](/wiki/Moon "Moon") is at last quarter.

Just as in real life, the *NetHack* world goes through several **phases of the moon**. [\[1\]](#cite_note-1) These have an effect on gameplay.

The date is only checked when the game is started or restored; if you keep playing without saving, you'll continue to see the effects even after the relevant period has passed (or not see the effects even though it has been reached). NetHack divides the month into eight phases of three or four days each; thus the full and new moon will be reported for a rather longer time than your calendar might depict.

During a **full moon**:

- Your base [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") is increased by one.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) (**"You are lucky! Full moon tonight."**)
- [Werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature"), especially at night, will usually be in their animal form.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- [Dogs](/wiki/Dog "Dog") will howl at night when #[chatted](/wiki/Chat "Chat") to.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)
- You have a chance of not being able to tame dogs at night; failed attempts will still pacify them, and you can try repeatedly.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

During a **new moon**:

- You get the message **"Be careful! New moon tonight."**
- Contrary to popular belief, Luck is not decreased.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)
- If a [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") uses its hissing attack and you have no [lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), you will always start turning into stone, rather than having a 1-in-10 chance.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Carrying a lizard corpse no longer negates the effect of a new moon on cockatrice hisses, as of [commit 8a9dc00](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/8a9dc00cde2cfe305c156a99a1d83129fe33e76e).

NetHack knows when it is **Friday the 13th**, and decreases your base Luck by one accordingly.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) The game gives a warning message: **"Watch out! Bad things can happen on Friday the 13th."**

If Friday the 13th happens to be a full moon, the modifiers to base Luck will cancel each other out. Between 1995 and 2025, Friday the 13th has occurred or will occur during (NetHack's definition of) a new or full moon on the following days:

| Date         | Year | Phase    |
| ------------ | ---- | -------- |
| September 13 | 1996 | **new**  |
| February 13  | 1998 | **full** |
| March 13     | 1998 | **full** |
| August 13    | 1999 | **new**  |
| October 13   | 2000 | **full** |
| June 13      | 2003 | **full** |
| March 13     | 2009 | **full** |

| Date         | Year | Phase    |
| ------------ | ---- | -------- |
| June 13      | 2014 | **full** |
| November 13  | 2015 | **new**  |
| January 13   | 2017 | **full** |
| July 13      | 2018 | **new**  |
| September 13 | 2019 | **full** |
| October 13   | 2023 | **new**  |
| June 13      | 2025 | **full** |

The [NAO](/wiki/NAO "NAO") [phase of moon page](https://alt.org/nethack/moon/pom.txt) shows both the current phase of the moon and when it will next be full moon.

## Time

**Night** is from 22:00 to 05:59 (10:00 p.m. to 5:59 a.m.) by your local clock, or by the server's clock if you are playing remotely. At night:

- Your chance of changing into your animal form when you have [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy") is one in every 60 moves instead of once in every 80 moves.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
- [Gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") can steal [intrinsics](/wiki/Intrinsics "Intrinsics").[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)
- Werecreatures can summon more easily, and are more likely to be in their animal form, particularly when the moon is full.

**Midnight** is 0:00 - 0:59. At midnight:

- [Undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") do twice as much damage.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)
- You get a different message when entering a [graveyard](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard"). ("Run away! Run away!" instead of "You have an uncanny feeling...")[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

Additionally, [vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)") can give [different messages](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\)#Messages "Vampire (monster class)") when #chatted to at night and midnight.

## Strategy

While changing the system clock is most certainly cheating, you may prefer to stop playing at night when around hostile gremlins, or at midnight when clearing out a graveyard.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [hacklib.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 564](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/hacklib.c#line564 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/hacklib.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [timeout.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 166](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/timeout.c#line166 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/timeout.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [were.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 18](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/were.c#line18 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/were.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [sounds.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 546](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/sounds.c#line546 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/sounds.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [dog.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 759](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/dog.c#line759 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/dog.c")
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [allmain.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 33](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/allmain.c#line33 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/allmain.c")
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [mhitu.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1190](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/mhitu.c#line1190 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/mhitu.c")
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [timeout.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 168](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/timeout.c#line168 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/timeout.c")
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [allmain.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 241](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/allmain.c#line241 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/allmain.c")
10. [↑](#cite_ref-10) [mhitu.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1428](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/mhitu.c#line1428 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/mhitu.c")
11. [↑](#cite_ref-11) [mhitu.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 907](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/mhitu.c#line907 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/mhitu.c")
12. [↑](#cite_ref-12) [hack.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1759](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/hack.c#line1759 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/hack.c")

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Time

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, the real-world time, date and moon phase all affect gameplay, and are determined by your system clock. While it is possible to change the system clock to get a desired moon phase or time, this is considered cheating.

Contents

  • 1 Moon phase and date
  • 2 Time
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 References

Moon phase and date

On 26 September 2024, the moon is at last quarter.

Just as in real life, the NetHack world goes through several phases of the moon. [1] These have an effect on gameplay.

The date is only checked when the game is started or restored; if you keep playing without saving, you'll continue to see the effects even after the relevant period has passed (or not see the effects even though it has been reached). NetHack divides the month into eight phases of three or four days each; thus the full and new moon will be reported for a rather longer time than your calendar might depict.

During a full moon:

  • Your base Luck is increased by one.[2] ("You are lucky! Full moon tonight.")
  • Werecreatures, especially at night, will usually be in their animal form.[3]
  • Dogs will howl at night when #chatted to.[4]
  • You have a chance of not being able to tame dogs at night; failed attempts will still pacify them, and you can try repeatedly.[5]

During a new moon:

  • You get the message "Be careful! New moon tonight."
  • Contrary to popular belief, Luck is not decreased.[6]
  • If a cockatrice uses its hissing attack and you have no lizard corpse, you will always start turning into stone, rather than having a 1-in-10 chance.[7]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Carrying a lizard corpse no longer negates the effect of a new moon on cockatrice hisses, as of commit 8a9dc00.

NetHack knows when it is Friday the 13th, and decreases your base Luck by one accordingly.[8] The game gives a warning message: "Watch out! Bad things can happen on Friday the 13th."

If Friday the 13th happens to be a full moon, the modifiers to base Luck will cancel each other out. Between 1995 and 2025, Friday the 13th has occurred or will occur during (NetHack's definition of) a new or full moon on the following days:

Date Year Phase
September 13 1996 new
February 13 1998 full
March 13 1998 full
August 13 1999 new
October 13 2000 full
June 13 2003 full
March 13 2009 full
Date Year Phase
June 13 2014 full
November 13 2015 new
January 13 2017 full
July 13 2018 new
September 13 2019 full
October 13 2023 new
June 13 2025 full

The NAO phase of moon page shows both the current phase of the moon and when it will next be full moon.

Time

Night is from 22:00 to 05:59 (10:00 p.m. to 5:59 a.m.) by your local clock, or by the server's clock if you are playing remotely. At night:

  • Your chance of changing into your animal form when you have lycanthropy is one in every 60 moves instead of once in every 80 moves.[9]
  • Gremlins can steal intrinsics.[10]
  • Werecreatures can summon more easily, and are more likely to be in their animal form, particularly when the moon is full.

Midnight is 0:00 - 0:59. At midnight:

  • Undead do twice as much damage.[11]
  • You get a different message when entering a graveyard. ("Run away! Run away!" instead of "You have an uncanny feeling...")[12]

Additionally, vampires can give different messages when #chatted to at night and midnight.

Strategy

While changing the system clock is most certainly cheating, you may prefer to stop playing at night when around hostile gremlins, or at midnight when clearing out a graveyard.

References

  1. ↑ hacklib.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 564
  2. ↑ timeout.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 166
  3. ↑ were.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 18
  4. ↑ sounds.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 546
  5. ↑ dog.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 759
  6. ↑ allmain.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 33
  7. ↑ mhitu.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1190
  8. ↑ timeout.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 168
  9. ↑ allmain.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 241
  10. ↑ mhitu.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1428
  11. ↑ mhitu.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 907
  12. ↑ hack.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1759

This page is based on a spoiler by Dylan O'Donnell. The original license is:

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

  1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
  2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

rawPage:
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the real-world '''time''', '''date''' and '''moon phase''' all affect gameplay, and are determined by your system clock. While it is possible to change the system clock to get a desired moon phase or time, this is considered [[cheating]].

=={{anchor|Moon phase}}Moon phase and date==
{{moon phase}}

Just as in real life, the ''NetHack'' world goes through several '''phases of the moon'''. {{refsrc|hacklib.c|564}} These have an effect on gameplay.

The date is only checked when the game is started or restored; if you keep playing without saving, you'll continue to see the effects even after the relevant period has passed (or not see the effects even though it has been reached). NetHack divides the month into eight phases of three or four days each; thus the full and new moon will be reported for a rather longer time than your calendar might depict.

During a '''full moon''':

* Your base [[Luck]] is increased by one.{{refsrc|timeout.c|166}} ('''"You are lucky! Full moon tonight."''')
* [[Werecreature]]s, especially at night, will usually be in their animal form.{{refsrc|were.c|18}}
* [[Dog]]s will howl at night when #[[chat]]ted to.{{refsrc|sounds.c|546}}
* You have a chance of not being able to tame dogs at night; failed attempts will still pacify them, and you can try repeatedly.{{refsrc|dog.c|759}}

During a '''new moon''':

* You get the message '''"Be careful! New moon tonight."'''
* Contrary to popular belief, Luck is not decreased.{{refsrc|allmain.c|33}}
* If a [[cockatrice]] uses its hissing attack and you have no [[lizard]] [[corpse]], you will always start turning into stone, rather than having a 1-in-10 chance.{{refsrc|mhitu.c|1190}}
{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Carrying a lizard corpse no longer negates the effect of a new moon on cockatrice hisses, as of {{commit|8a9dc00cde2cfe305c156a99a1d83129fe33e76e|commit 8a9dc00}}.}}

NetHack knows when it is '''Friday the 13th''', and decreases your base Luck by one accordingly.{{refsrc|timeout.c|168}} The game gives a warning message: '''"Watch out! Bad things can happen on Friday the 13th."''' 

If Friday the 13th happens to be a full moon, the modifiers to base Luck will cancel each other out. Between 1995 and 2025, Friday the 13th has occurred or will occur during (NetHack's definition of) a new or full moon on the following days:

{| class="wikitable" style="float:left"
! Date !! Year !! Phase
|-
|September 13 || 1996 || '''new'''
|-

|-

The [[NAO]] [https://alt.org/nethack/moon/pom.txt phase of moon page] shows both the current phase of the moon and when it will next be full moon.

==Time==
'''Night''' is from 22:00 to 05:59 (10:00 p.m. to 5:59 a.m.) by your local clock, or by the server's clock if you are playing remotely. At night:

* Your chance of changing into your animal form when you have [[lycanthropy]] is one in every 60 moves instead of once in every 80 moves.{{refsrc|allmain.c|241}}
* [[Gremlin]]s can steal [[intrinsics]].{{refsrc|mhitu.c|1428}}
* Werecreatures can summon more easily, and are more likely to be in their animal form, particularly when the moon is full.

'''Midnight''' is 0:00 - 0:59. At midnight:

* [[Undead]] do twice as much damage.{{refsrc|mhitu.c|907}}
* You get a different message when entering a [[graveyard]]. ("Run away! Run away!" instead of "You have an uncanny feeling..."){{refsrc|hack.c|1759}}

Additionally, [[Vampire (monster class)|vampires]] can give [[Vampire (monster class)#Messages|different messages]] when #chatted to at night and midnight.

==Strategy==
While changing the system clock is most certainly cheating, you may prefer to stop playing at night when around hostile gremlins, or at midnight when clearing out a graveyard.
